text: hi everyone my name is Chris Rogers I'm
a business development manager on the
AWS global storage team I'm here to talk
to you about how AWS Storage gateways
tape gateway can save you from the
hassle and expense of managing backups
and archives using physical tapes
protecting data is fundamental for all
businesses and it's critical to ensure
business continuity however I talked to
many organizations that still rely on
out-of-date backup technologies old
backup systems cost a lot of money and
require significant time and resources
to keep them running tape gateway
provides a drop-in replacement to
physical tape infrastructure allowing
you to backup data as virtual tapes to
AWS the best part is that you can do
this without changing your current
backup workflows or applications tape
gateway supports a wide variety of
backup applications from vendors such as
Veritas CommVault Veeam Delhi MC and
others so it's easy to seamlessly
transition your backups off of physical
tapes and into AWS so how does tape
gateway work well you connect your
existing backup application to a tape
gateway deployed on a virtual machine or
hardware appliance that sits in your
data center tape gateway then compresses
and crypts and moves your data to a
virtual tape library stored in Amazon s3
once your virtual tapes are in s3 you
can archive them to longer-term storage
options like Amazon s3 glacier or Amazon
s3 glacier deep archive Amazon s3
glacier is best for active archives data
that you may need to access from time to
time maybe once per month for example it
typically takes 3 to 5 hours to retrieve
tapes archived in s3 glacier s3 glacier
deep archive is best suited for
long-term data retention and digital
preservation this is best for data that
you need to preserve but may not need to
access more than say once per year and
possibly even less than that with s3
glacier deep archive retrieval times
typically take about 12 hours so what
are the benefits of using tape gateway
to store virtual tapes in AWS compared
to storing tapes off-site there are
several reasons to consider tape gateway
first all virtual tapes stored in s3
glacier deep archive are replicated and
stored across at least three
geographically dispersed availability
zones protected by eleven nines of
durability second AWS performs of
regular error checks to confirm your
data is available to be read by your
application when you need it third all
tapes stored in s3 glacier deep archive
are protected by s3 server-side
encryption using either default keys or
your own AWS key management service keys
in addition you also avoid the physical
security risk associated with tracking
and monitoring the location in the
condition of physical tapes fourth
restoring data from degraded or broken
tapes that have been stored off-site can
be frustrating and can result in data
loss with tape gateway you always get
the right data and finally you can save
a lot of money in monthly storage costs
storing your data in s3 glacier deep
archive costs only $1.00 per terabyte
per month in most AWS regions that's $12
per year to store one terabyte of data
so to learn more about how you can start
using tape gateway today for your backup
and archival needs visit aws.amazon.com
slash storage gateway slash VTL thanks
very much for watching
[Music]
